Marchman By Rebecca Gleiberman With the recent uptick in high rises and chain restaurants, South Main Station seeks to keep things local and bring a return to what makes Greater Gainesville special. The lot that has become South Main Station is rich with history. Originally built as a cotton gin in 1882, the building burnt down in 1907. The property was later purchased by Baird Hardware Company due to its proximity to the train depot ‚Äì‚Äì now known as Depot Park. The railroad ran along the side of the still-standing Baird Warehouse, where its tracks are still visible today. Nearly 100 years after the cotton gin, the old Baird Warehouse was purchased by Hoch Shitama and became the home of his company Akira Wood , an architectural woodworking business that remains there to this day. With the vision of creating a public space for the community, the Shitama family considered the idea of reimagining the space. When Depot Park was developed, driving business toward the Southeast portion of town, the idea slowly became a reality. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been interested in design for a long time, this idea of creating beautiful spaces. It‚Äôs something Akira has done for a long time. They have worked with world-class architects but mostly in other places because Gainesville is such a small town. So, I think our family sees this as an opportunity to really build something beautiful like that here, in our home space and in this community that is very dear to us and that we‚Äôre very connected to,‚Äù said Mariko Shitama, daughter of Hoch Shitama and director of development for South Main Station. With restaurants that include Humble Wood Fire and Bingo Deli , as well as the Heartwood Soundstage for live music and events, and a weekly farmers market, South Main Station is set to become a local hot spot, with a vision to expand even more in the future. ‚ÄúOur long-term vision for the space is to create a campus-like environment that is pedestrian-oriented, with retail and food and drink and lots of connected outdoor space where you can come and spend a couple hours or a whole day,‚Äù said Shitama. A mixed-use space that will include retail and a food hall is the ultimate vision for South Main Station. Another upcoming addition to the space is Grand Scheme Brewing which owners Joe Simmons and Brett Ader will be opening in 2023 in between Bingo Deli and Humble Wood Fire. ‚ÄúWe are very excited for this next addition to South Main Station,‚Äù said Shitama. With these newest plans in the works, South Main Station is evolving from not only a thriving hub of local business but a thriving community in itself. Businesses and Events at South Main Station Heartwood Soundstage ‚Äì Recording studio and music venue Akira Wood ‚Äì Architectural woodworking Humble Wood Fire ‚Äì Pizzeria location. Regular menu and espresso Wednesday ‚Äì Sunday 11 AM ‚Äì 9 PM and Brunch Friday‚ÄìSunday, 9 a.m. ‚Äì 2 p.m. Bingo Deli + Pub ‚Äì Focused on local and seasonal cuisine. Open for dinner Monday, Wednesday, and Friday 5 ‚Äì 9 PM; Wednesday 4 ‚Äì 9 PM; and open for lunch and dinner Saturday and Sunday, 12 ‚Äì 8 p.m. GNV Farmers‚Äô Market ‚Äì Live music, local farmers, bakers and crafters open Thursdays, 4 p.m. ‚Äì 7 p.m. COMING SOON 2023: Grand Scheme Brewing Sign Up to Our Newsletter Get notified about exclusive offers every week! SIGN UP I would like to receive news and special offers. Learn more about Grand Scheme Brewing Nestled in the vibrant city of Gainesville, Florida, Grand Scheme Brewing stands out as a must-visit destination for beer enthusiasts and casual patrons alike. This beloved establishment, located in the 32601 area, is a gem in the local brewery scene. Grand Scheme Brewing offers a unique and inviting atmosphere where visitors can relax and unwind while savoring a wide selection of expertly crafted beers. From hoppy IPAs to rich stouts and refreshing lagers, there is a brew to suit every palate. The knowledgeable staff at Grand Scheme Brewing is passionate about their craft and always happy to recommend the perfect pint for each guest. The brewery's dedication to quality extends beyond its beverages. The industrial-chic decor, complete with exposed brick walls and sleek wooden accents, creates a trendy yet cozy ambiance that sets the stage for a memorable experience. Whether you're enjoying a cold beer at the bar or gathering with friends in the spacious seating area, Grand Scheme Brewing offers a welcoming space for all. In addition to its exceptional beer selection and inviting atmosphere, Grand Scheme Brewing frequently hosts exciting events and special promotions, making each visit a new and exciting experience. From trivia nights to live music performances, there is always something happening at this lively establishment. For a taste of the local beer scene in Gainesville, look no further than Grand Scheme Brewing. With its stellar brews, inviting atmosphere, and commitment to excellence, this brewery has earned its place as a beloved favorite among locals and visitors alike. Grand Central Brewhouse | Brewery in St. Petersburg, FL Skip to content About Our Story Our Team Our Mission Code Of Conduct On Tap Our Beer Food LALA St. Pete Menu Community Brew good SUSTAINABILITY Visit TAPROOM BEER GARDEN STAMMTISCH TERRACE Events Private Events Book An Event Contact About Our Story Our Team Our Mission Code Of Conduct On Tap Our Beer Food LALA St. Pete Menu Community Brew good SUSTAINABILITY Visit TAPROOM BEER GARDEN STAMMTISCH TERRACE Events Private Events Book An Event Contact Facebook Instagram Brewery, Taproom and Beer Garden in St. Petersburg, FL Local Brews and Vibrant Vibes at  Grand Central Brewhouse in St. Pete Discover the essence of St. Pete‚Äôs craft beer culture at Grand Central Brewhouse‚Äîa dynamic, two-story brewery, taproom, and beer garden that‚Äôs the heartbeat of the community. Renowned for its expertly crafted lagers, Grand Central Brewhouse seamlessly blends tradition with innovation, offering an experience that‚Äôs as authentic as it is enjoyable. The taproom at Grand Central Brewhouse is more than just a place to grab a drink; it‚Äôs where local flavors and community spirit come to life. Enjoy a pint alongside American pub favorites and Mediterranean-inspired dishes from LALA St. Pete, all within a space designed for connection and relaxation. Whether it‚Äôs mingling in the spacious beer garden or attending one of the many vibrant events hosted here, Grand Central Brewhouse offers a welcoming atmosphere for all. VIEW TAP LIST See Menu BUILT FOR COMMUNITY BREWED WITH HEART What sets Grand Central Brewhouse apart is its commitment to giving back. With every sip, you‚Äôre contributing to local causes, as a portion of proceeds supports charitable initiatives in the community. This dedication to making a difference makes Grand Central Brewhouse more than just a brewery‚Äîit‚Äôs a place where great beer, good food, and purpose come together. More Details SPECIALTY & QUALITY BEERS From the time-honored ingredients and brewing techniques to the thoughtfully selected glassware, our beers pay homage to tradition. We offer a variety of classic styles with a focus on artisanal lagers that range from golden to black and crisp to malty. Our lagers are stored using European serving tank technology to ensure that every distinct flavor makes it to your glass as intended. VIEW TAP LIST FOOD BY LALA ST. PETE While visiting Grand Central Brewhouse, order food from LALA St. Pete without leaving your seat. Choose from a wide variety of Meditarranean-inspired dishes and elevated American cuisine. SEE MENU ROOM FOR ALL Steps away from Central Avenue, our expansive indoor and outdoor spaces offer an urban, dog-friendly retreat for the community to gather, bond, make memories, and celebrate. Explore the Space HOST A PRIVATE EVENT Book our Stammtisch room and terrace for your next special gathering. LEARN MORE Why Choose Grand Central Brewhouse? Experience specialty craft beers in one of St. Pete‚Äôs most iconic breweries. Indulge in thoughtfully curated dishes from LALA St. Pete while enjoying a relaxed, stylish ambiance. Support local charities with every visit, knowing your experience makes a positive impact. At Grand Central Brewhouse, you‚Äôll find more than just exceptional brews‚Äîyou‚Äôll find a vibrant community hub where tradition, taste, and togetherness thrive. Visit today and see why Grand Central Brewhouse is a must-experience destination in St. Pete. More Details what our customers say about us Ben 7 months ago Good beer, a clean spacious environment, and friendly beertenders. 10/10 ... Chris Redfield 7 months ago Fantastic coffee stout, and also food from next door great. ... Samantha Shikany 7 months ago Best brewery hands down!!! Best beer, best crew, best atmosphere around! My home away from home! ... Avi Genuth 8 months ago Had an amazing experience! The beer was great and CJ was a great bartender and guide! ... Michael Sedita 8 months ago Great beer, staff, and vibe. ... Ric Rini 8 months ago Fantastic location for large parties. The venue has large open spaces with an outside non covered patio where live music is played. Roof top patio bar with a covered climate controlled section that is warm and welcoming, gives you that cozy feeling. The beer is Lager centric but they have a fantastic variety of other brews on tap and the quality is superb.  Hungry? No problem food is prepared by LaLa (just next door) with a twist on Mediterranean bar bites. This is a clean inviting place that you can just hangout for hours. ... Nahiyan Khan 8 months ago I hosted my wedding rehearsal dinner event here and the staff was amazing and extremely helpful! Brenda and Stacy were so helpful in answering my questions leading up to the event and were so helpful on site during the event too -- absolutely made everything seamless. The private event space upstairs is beautiful, my guests loved it. Thank you GCB! ... Philip Cropp 8 months ago Love the vibe, beers & staff. If I still lived in DTSP, this would be my spot. üç∫ ... nathan miller 8 months ago Great beer, atmosphere, and live music with food next door‚Ä¶can‚Äôt ask for much more! ... Join us on Sunday, September 7 at 5 PM when The Sundaes take the stage for a Sunday night set you won‚Äôt want to miss. If you could piece together a supergroup whose harmonies could stretch the weekend just a little longer, this would be it. Each member brings their own talent and energy, coming together to create a sound that feels equal parts timeless and feel-good. Come hang. 10 1 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 18020757095751390 10 1 Speak Easy returns to GCB On September 6th at 7PM with their signature blend of groove-heavy rhythm, catchy lyrics, and high-energy performance. Since forming at USFSP in 2017, they‚Äôve become a staple of the St. Pete music scene and have played stages across Florida including Gasparilla Music Fest, Clearwater Jazz Fest, and the Floridian Social Club. Expect electric guitar solos, tight harmonies, and a sound that‚Äôs sure to move a crowd. 14 0 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 18049245218298443 14 0 SkaFest Vol. 3 was an absolute blast. Thanks to everyone who came out to dance, drink, and make it another unforgettable day. Our SkaFest shirts went fast this year and we‚Äôre already down to fewer than 20 left. Mediums are sold out, but we still have a handful of Smalls, plus L, XL, and 2XL. If you missed grabbing one at the festival, now‚Äôs the time to stop by and pick one up before they‚Äôre gone. 46 3 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 18075631139018210 46 3 Pinellas Run Club meets tonight (September 4th) at 6 PM right here at the brewery. After a quick overview, runners and walkers head out for a their chosen distance route. After the run enjoy $2 off GCB beers. It‚Äôs one of the biggest run clubs in the area and always a great time. 27 0 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 17847367746556737 27 0 On Friday, September 5 at 6 PM Crisis the Jazz Project returns to GCB! If you haven‚Äôt heard of them before, they are a jazz project featuring members of well-known Tampa Bay bands stepping outside their usual sound. Blending their backgrounds into something unexpected, this group brings a fresh take on jazz with familiar faces in less familiar territory. Catch them live and see what happens when musicians push past the edges of their genre. 11 0 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 17999308943656733 11 0 Our latest collaboration with @pointybelbrew, Rice Rice Baby, is a clean and refreshing rice lager brewed with Riverbend Pilsner malt and jasmine rice. The rice lends a delicate floral aroma and a subtle sweetness that lightens the body while keeping the finish crisp and dry. Perle and Saaz hops add gentle spice and a touch of herbal character that complement the malt and rice without overpowering them. The result is a bright lager with notes of toasted baguette and fragrant jasmine blossom, culminating in a clean, refreshing close. At 4.5% ABV, this lager shows that true complexity can be found in simplicity. Rice Rice Baby is on tap now, and we`ll also be pouring it today, Sunday August 31, at the Cool & Crispy Festival at Point Ybel Brewing. Stop by and grab a glass! 33 2 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 18057786497113047 33 2 On Sunday, August 31 at 2 PM The Fernando Cruz Trio returns to Grand Central Brewhouse for an afternoon of rich, expressive jazz led by saxophonist, composer, and educator Fernando Cruz. A standout in the Florida music scene, Fernando brings a deep, soulful energy to the stage inspired by legends like Coltrane, Rollins, and Parker. Join us for a performance that blends technical mastery with heartfelt improvisation. 8 0 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 18491141893069259 8 0 Today‚Äôs the day! SkaFest Vol. 3: Lager‚Äôs Not Dead kicks off at 1 PM. We‚Äôve got seven bands lined up to keep the music rolling all day long, fresh lagers pouring nonstop, and some great vendors joining the party. Music starts at 1 PM and runs through the night. Grab your crew, lace up those dancing shoes, and get ready to skank the day away with us! 41 3 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 17917168335157232 41 3 SkaFest is back this Saturday! Lager‚Äôs Not Dead: SkaFest Vol. 3 hits Grand Central Brewhouse on Saturday, August 30 from 1 PM to 10 PM, and it‚Äôs shaping up to be one of the best yet. The lineup: üí• Eric Best ‚Äì 1 PM - 1:45PM üí• Over Wait Mammal ‚Äì 2 PM - 2:45 PM üí• Saganaki Bomb Squad ‚Äì 3 PM - 3:45 PM üí• Chilled Monkey Brains ‚Äì 4 PM - 5 PM üí• Floridaze ‚Äì 5:15 PM - 6:30 PM üí• Control This! ‚Äì 6:45 PM - 7:45 PM üí• Victims of Circumstance ‚Äì 8 PM - 9:45 PM We‚Äôll have a wide array of fresh lagers pouring all day, a misting tent to keep you cool, and vendors like JB‚Äôs Hot Dogs, Churned Ice Cream, and Planet Retro hanging out for the day. This event takes place in the Beer Garden and will be held rain or shine. We have plenty of tent coverage set up for the occasion. *Performance times are subject to change. See you at SkaFest! 38 0 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 17981312699736682 38 0 On Friday, August 29 at 6 PM Ultra Vinyl takes the stage with a set full of hits from across the decades. This Tampa Bay-based cover band brings a polished, high-energy performance that‚Äôs perfect for fans of live music you know and love. Whether you‚Äôre here to dance or just enjoy a great show with a beer in hand, Ultra Vinyl delivers the soundtrack. 5 0 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 18058524002105109 5 0 21 2 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 17853359745469320 21 2 On Saturday, August 23 at 6 PM The Rich Sheldon Band brings their blend of soulful Americana, folk, and roots rock to Grand Central Brewhouse. Meet the Founder - Grand Central Brewhouse Skip to content About Our Story Our Team Our Mission Code Of Conduct On Tap Our Beer Food LALA St. Pete Menu Community Brew good SUSTAINABILITY Visit TAPROOM BEER GARDEN STAMMTISCH TERRACE Events Private Events Book An Event Contact About Our Story Our Team Our Mission Code Of Conduct On Tap Our Beer Food LALA St. Pete Menu Community Brew good SUSTAINABILITY Visit TAPROOM BEER GARDEN STAMMTISCH TERRACE Events Private Events Book An Event Contact Facebook Instagram Brewery, Taproom and Beer Garden in St. Petersburg, FL Meet the Founder KEVIN MILKEY Kevin Milkey, our visionary founder, made the leap from a successful insurance career to the craft beer world. His passion and expertise drive the success of our craft beer brewery. After retiring from a successful career in insurance, Kevin has decided to take his talents to the craft beer industry. Exactly what those talents are remains debatable. But what is not debatable is his love of beer and spending time at craft breweries. Prior to establishing Grand Central Brewhouse, Kevin was one of the three original employees at American Strategic Insurance, more commonly known as ASI, a property insurance company based in St. Petersburg. After 21 years at ASI and following the acquisition of ASI by Progressive Insurance Group, Kevin retired from ASI. But long before he retired, he dreamt of owning a craft brewery someday. Kevin was an early enthusiast of craft beers, long before most people had heard of craft beers or microbrews. Before any craft breweries opened locally, Kevin regularly stopped into Shep‚Äôs on Fourth Street to pick up new craft beer to sample from around the country. Kevin, his wife Jeanne, and son Jack love to travel and craft breweries, pubs, beer halls, and beer tours became a significant part of the itinerary wherever they traveled in both the U.S. and Europe. The laid-back environment and large variety of innovative beers at craft breweries presented the ideal combination to spend quality time. In recent years, the brewery stops have become ‚Äúresearch‚Äù trips. Kevin has incorporated many ideas from breweries and pubs from around the world into his vision for Grand Central Brewhouse, most notably serving beer directly from serving tanks. Kevin has also completed the Brewing Arts Program offered by USF St. Petersburg where he not only learned how to brew beer but gained foundational knowledge of owning and operating a brewery. Kevin moved to Florida from New York City in 1991 and quickly fell in love with the Tampa Bay area. Away from the brewery, Kevin is very active in the community, sitting on two charitable boards and supporting several local non-profits through the Milkey Family Foundation he established with Jeanne to support local charities in the St. Petersburg area. He is a huge sports fan and enthusiastically supports our Tampa Bay professional teams. An avid runner, Kevin has completed 11 marathons, which helps complement his other passion, beer. return to news Join us on Sunday, September 7 at 5 PM when The Sundaes take the stage for a Sunday night set you won‚Äôt want to miss. If you could piece together a supergroup whose harmonies could stretch the weekend just a little longer, this would be it. Each member brings their own talent and energy, coming together to create a sound that feels equal parts timeless and feel-good. Come hang. 10 1 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 18020757095751390 10 1 Speak Easy returns to GCB On September 6th at 7PM with their signature blend of groove-heavy rhythm, catchy lyrics, and high-energy performance. Since forming at USFSP in 2017, they‚Äôve become a staple of the St. Pete music scene and have played stages across Florida including Gasparilla Music Fest, Clearwater Jazz Fest, and the Floridian Social Club. Expect electric guitar solos, tight harmonies, and a sound that‚Äôs sure to move a crowd. 14 0 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 18049245218298443 14 0 SkaFest Vol. 3 was an absolute blast. Thanks to everyone who came out to dance, drink, and make it another unforgettable day. Our SkaFest shirts went fast this year and we‚Äôre already down to fewer than 20 left. Mediums are sold out, but we still have a handful of Smalls, plus L, XL, and 2XL. If you missed grabbing one at the festival, now‚Äôs the time to stop by and pick one up before they‚Äôre gone. 46 3 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 18075631139018210 46 3 Pinellas Run Club meets tonight (September 4th) at 6 PM right here at the brewery. After a quick overview, runners and walkers head out for a their chosen distance route. After the run enjoy $2 off GCB beers. It‚Äôs one of the biggest run clubs in the area and always a great time. 27 0 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 17847367746556737 27 0 On Friday, September 5 at 6 PM Crisis the Jazz Project returns to GCB! If you haven‚Äôt heard of them before, they are a jazz project featuring members of well-known Tampa Bay bands stepping outside their usual sound. Blending their backgrounds into something unexpected, this group brings a fresh take on jazz with familiar faces in less familiar territory. Catch them live and see what happens when musicians push past the edges of their genre. 11 0 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 17999308943656733 11 0 Our latest collaboration with @pointybelbrew, Rice Rice Baby, is a clean and refreshing rice lager brewed with Riverbend Pilsner malt and jasmine rice. The rice lends a delicate floral aroma and a subtle sweetness that lightens the body while keeping the finish crisp and dry. Perle and Saaz hops add gentle spice and a touch of herbal character that complement the malt and rice without overpowering them. The result is a bright lager with notes of toasted baguette and fragrant jasmine blossom, culminating in a clean, refreshing close. At 4.5% ABV, this lager shows that true complexity can be found in simplicity. Rice Rice Baby is on tap now, and we`ll also be pouring it today, Sunday August 31, at the Cool & Crispy Festival at Point Ybel Brewing. Stop by and grab a glass! 33 2 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 18057786497113047 33 2 On Sunday, August 31 at 2 PM The Fernando Cruz Trio returns to Grand Central Brewhouse for an afternoon of rich, expressive jazz led by saxophonist, composer, and educator Fernando Cruz. A standout in the Florida music scene, Fernando brings a deep, soulful energy to the stage inspired by legends like Coltrane, Rollins, and Parker. Join us for a performance that blends technical mastery with heartfelt improvisation. 8 0 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 18491141893069259 8 0 Today‚Äôs the day! SkaFest Vol. 3: Lager‚Äôs Not Dead kicks off at 1 PM. We‚Äôve got seven bands lined up to keep the music rolling all day long, fresh lagers pouring nonstop, and some great vendors joining the party. Music starts at 1 PM and runs through the night. Grab your crew, lace up those dancing shoes, and get ready to skank the day away with us! 41 3 Open post by grandcentralbrewhouse with ID 17917168335157232 41 3 SkaFest is back this Saturday! Lager‚Äôs Not Dead: SkaFest Vol. 3 hits Grand Central Brewhouse on Saturday, August 30 from 1 PM to 10 PM, and it‚Äôs shaping up to be one of the best yet. The lineup: üí• Eric Best ‚Äì 1 PM - 1:45PM üí• Over Wait Mammal ‚Äì 2 PM - 2:45 PM üí• Saganaki Bomb Squad ‚Äì 3 PM - 3:45 PM üí• Chilled Monkey Brains ‚Äì 4 PM - 5 PM üí• Floridaze ‚Äì 5:15 PM - 6:30 PM üí• Control This! ‚Äì 6:45 PM - 7:45 PM üí• Victims of Circumstance ‚Äì 8 PM - 9:45 PM We‚Äôll have a wide array of fresh lagers pouring all day, a misting tent to keep you cool, and vendors like JB‚Äôs Hot Dogs, Churned Ice Cream, and Planet Retro hanging out for the day. This event takes place in the Beer Garden and will be held rain or shine. We have plenty of tent coverage set up for the occasion. *Performance times are subject to change. Sisyphus Brewing | About Us BUY  COMEDY  TICKETS  HERE! OUR BEER + - On Tap ABOUT + - Taproom Our Story COMEDY & EVENTS + - Events Calendar & Tickets PRIVATE PARTIES + - Event Space Rental Cart ( $ 0.00 ) OUR BEER + - On Tap ABOUT + - Taproom Our Story COMEDY & EVENTS + - Events Calendar & Tickets PRIVATE PARTIES + - Event Space Rental Cart ( $ 0.00 ) About Sisyphus Brewing Why did you name your brewery Sisyphus? Where did the name come from? I have been asked these questions thousands of times, but I have in the past been afraid to give the true answer. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs the greek guy, you know the one that pushes a rock up a hill over and over again. We have a small brew system, so we are like Sisyphus, always brewing.‚Äù That‚Äôs my stock answer, and it‚Äôs partially right, but hides the truth with its seemingly peaceful musing . I used to spend an inordinate amount of time thinking about suicide. It seemed to be the only thought that permeated my head, nearly everyday, for many years. I was taught that mental health issues are shameful, and are not to be discussed. So I suffered in quiet, alone in my own head. My junior year of college, I took a philosophy class that introduced me to the philosophical essay, ‚ÄúThe Myth of Sisyphus.‚Äù Which begins with a phrase that most certainly caught Suicidal Sam‚Äôs attention. ‚ÄúThere is only one true philosophical problem, and that is suicide. Deciding whether or not life is worth living, is to answer the fundamental question in philosophy. All other questions follow from that.‚Äù For the first time in my life, I felt not alone. Like someone understood. Ironically that someone was a dead Frenchman, but I felt connected like never before. I read, and I agreed. Man is here on Earth, with limited faculties, but within those faculties lie the ability to comprehend our place in the universe. Sisyphus is each of us. The rock is the absurdity of the universe. The confrontation between the meaninglessness of a single life in an infinite universe. No rocks we move can carve our place in the history of the universe, for we are just organic matter moving around other organic and inorganic matter. Nothing we do can matter in the grand scheme of things. We, as humans, can‚Äôt help but think about the big picture, and suddenly our existence seems to stop mattering. I feel as if I am a single raindrop identified and named in a monsoon. Only the naming and following of said raindrop so closely distinguishes it from the millions that fall next to, before, and after it. We could name all of the raindrops if we liked and found the time. Like raindrops, our fate was bore as our journey began. We travel from one point, birth, to another point, death, and hope to prosper on the way. But why? Why do we care? Why do we want to live? Why should we live? What is the point of all this? And this line of questioning, led me to dark places, where it seemed the only escape was a final escape. But then Camus, and Sisyphus, and I started listening to a voice in my head that had been silenced long ago. It was my voice, telling me what I wanted in life. I wanted a challenge, I wanted to do something I love. Something that made me greet the cold indifference of the universe head on, and defy it as I pushed forward into life. There is so much to humanity that gets lost in the scale of the universe. There is music, love, laughter, food, dancing, and of course beer. There‚Äôs a near infinite number of things to explore on our planet, and beyond. I wanted to do it, as much as possible, before time ran out. But my depression was still there, and I did what I had avoided for so long, I sought help. And it helped. And I‚Äôm still here today. Seek help if you need it, it makes you stronger, not weaker. Your struggle isn‚Äôt unique, it isn‚Äôt shameful, it is part of being human. We are here as a relaxing retreat from it all, a brewery comedy club, made out of a vision and desire to thrive. ¬†And we think it's a pretty cool spot. TAPROOM HOURS Monday : closed Tuesday/Wednesday: 4 - 9PM Thursday: 4 - 11PM Friday/Saturday: 1 - 11PM Sunday: 1 - 6PM SISYPHUS BREWING - MINNEAPOLIS 712 Ontario Avenue West #100 Minneapolis, MN 55403 Entrance is around the corner on Aldrich (612) 444-8674 Quick Drinks Home Tap List Events Calendar Host an Event BUY TICKETS ¬© Sisyphus Brewing 2025 Ecommerce Software by Shopify Pipeline Theme Twitter Facebook Instagram
